Detailed Description

This is a singleton class that manages SimpleGUIComponents.

It maintains the roots of the GUI component tree.

Any components added to / created by the SimpleGUI will be automatically freed upon destruction.

void SimpleGUI::dragDistance ( float  distance  ) 

Sets the minimum distance the mouse pointer has to travel after the left mouse button has been pressed before the movement is considered a drag.

Parameters:
distance the minimum drag distance (float, in clip space). The default value is 0.002.

It should be called before Script::fini.

bool SimpleGUI::handleAxisEvent ( const AxisEvent &  event  )  [virtual]

This method handles axis events for the gui system.

Axis events are passed on to the current component that has the focus, if any.

Parameters:
event The axis event to handle.
Returns:
True if the axis event was handled.

Reimplemented from InputHandler.

bool SimpleGUI::handleKeyEvent ( const KeyEvent &  event  )  [virtual]

This method handles key events for the gui system.

Key events are passed on to the current component that has the focus, if any.

Parameters:
event The key event to handle.
Returns:
True if the key event was handled.

Reimplemented from InputHandler.

bool SimpleGUI::handleMouseEvent ( const MouseEvent &  event  )  [virtual]

This method handles mouse events for the gui system.

Mouse events are passed on to the whatever component is at the mouse location.

Parameters:
event The mouse event to handle.
Returns:
True if the mouse event was handled.

Reimplemented from InputHandler.

uint32 SimpleGUI::realScreenResolutionCounter (  )  const

This method returns a counter for the current screen resolution used by the GUI.

This value is only increased if the actual resolution is changed by the device.

Returns:
Current resolution counter

const Vector2 & SimpleGUI::resolutionOverride (  )  const

Gets the current resolution override.

void SimpleGUI::resolutionOverride ( const Vector2 &  res  ) 

Sets the current resolution override.

This overrides what the GUI system thinks the current resolution is (good for scaling UI's that use PIXEL layout modes). Setting this to a zero vector disables the override
